title: Responsible-Vibe Development: responsible-vibe
description: Development session using epcc workflow for responsible-vibe

title: Explore
description: epcc workflow explore phase tasks

title: Analyze current beads phase task creation in BeadsIntegration class
description: Investigate why all phases in the plan file reference the same beads-phase-id (responsible-vibe-1) instead of unique phase task IDs. The beads integration should have created separate phase tasks (like responsible-vibe-1.1, responsible-vibe-1.2, etc.) but the plan file shows all phases pointing to the epic ID. This prevents proper phase-to-phase dependencies. Examine the plan file generation and phase task ID linking logic in the responsible-vibe-mcp codebase.

title: Examine beads instruction generation for task descriptions
description: Look at how responsible-vibe-mcp generates beads instructions in whats_next() responses. Check if the generated instructions encourage using --description parameter when creating tasks, or if they use the simplified format without detailed descriptions. Focus on instruction-generator.ts and beads-integration.ts generateBeadsInstructions() method.

title: Research beads dependency management capabilities
description: Study beads CLI documentation and test the --blocks parameter to understand how to create task dependencies. Test commands like 'bd update task-id --blocks previous-task-id' to see how beads handles sequential workflows. This will inform the solution design for making phases depend on each other.

title: Investigate TBD placeholder replacement failure
description: The plan file shows all phases with beads-phase-id: responsible-vibe-1 instead of unique task IDs (responsible-vibe-1.1, responsible-vibe-1.2, etc.). This means updatePlanFileWithPhaseTaskIds() in start-development.ts failed to replace TBD placeholders. Investigate: 1) Whether the phaseTasks array contains correct data 2) Whether the regex pattern matching is working 3) Whether the phase names match between workflow and plan file 4) Whether file writing completed successfully

title: Test beads phase task creation manually
description: Manually test the BeadsIntegration.createPhaseTasks() method to see what data it returns. Create a simple test script that calls this method with test data and logs the resulting phaseTasks array to verify if it contains correct individual task IDs or if it incorrectly returns epic IDs for all phases.

title: Test task to see output format
description: Testing beads output format

title: Plan
description: epcc workflow plan phase tasks

title: Design regex fix implementation strategy
description: Plan the fix for the regex pattern bug in BeadsIntegration.createPhaseTasks(). Analyze: 1) Which regex patterns need updating (both createProjectEpic and createPhaseTasks methods), 2) Test the new pattern against various beads ID formats, 3) Ensure backwards compatibility with different beads versions, 4) Consider edge cases like malformed output. Design a safe rollout approach with proper testing.

title: Plan phase dependency creation feature
description: Design the implementation for automatic phase dependencies in beads integration. Plan: 1) Add createPhaseDependencies() method to BeadsIntegration class, 2) Determine when to call it (after createPhaseTasks but before plan file update), 3) Design error handling for dependency creation failures, 4) Consider configuration options (enable/disable phase dependencies), 5) Plan integration with existing start-development workflow. Include rollback strategy if dependency creation fails.

title: Design enhanced beads instructions with descriptions
description: Plan the enhancement of generateBeadsInstructions() method to encourage --description parameter usage. Design: 1) Update instruction templates to show --description examples, 2) Provide guidance on writing good task descriptions, 3) Consider different instruction formats for different workflow phases, 4) Plan integration with existing instruction generation in whats_next() responses, 5) Design backwards compatibility for users who prefer simple commands. Include examples and best practices.

title: Plan testing strategy for beads integration fixes
description: Design comprehensive testing approach for the beads integration improvements. Plan: 1) Unit tests for regex pattern changes with various ID formats, 2) Integration tests for phase dependency creation, 3) End-to-end tests for full start-development workflow with dependencies, 4) Test instruction generation enhancement, 5) Backwards compatibility testing with existing beads installations, 6) Error scenario testing (beads unavailable, malformed output, dependency failures). Include test data and mock strategies.

title: Code
description: epcc workflow code phase tasks

title: Fix regex patterns in BeadsIntegration class
description: Fix the three regex patterns that exclude periods in task ID extraction: 1) Lines 133-134 in createProjectEpic() method, 2) Lines 224-225 in createPhaseTasks() method, 3) Line 456 in createEntranceCriteriaTasks() method. Change [\w\d-]+ to [\w\d.-]+ to capture full beads task IDs with periods. Test with existing beads output to ensure compatibility.

title: Implement createPhaseDependencies method
description: Add new createPhaseDependencies() method to BeadsIntegration class that creates sequential dependencies between workflow phases using 'bd dep' commands. Method should: 1) Take phaseTasks array as input, 2) Create dependencies in sequence (Explore→Plan→Code→Commit), 3) Use 'bd dep taskA --blocks taskB' syntax, 4) Include proper error handling that logs warnings but doesn't fail setup, 5) Return success status for monitoring. Integrate into start-development.ts workflow.

title: Enhance generateBeadsInstructions with description guidance
description: Update generateBeadsInstructions() method to encourage --description parameter usage. Replace current pattern 'bd create Task description --parent X -p 2' with 'bd create Task title --parent X --description Detailed context explaining what, why, and how --priority 2'. Add examples of good task descriptions and guidance on writing effective context. Maintain backwards compatibility by including both formats with clear preference for descriptions.

title: Add unit tests for regex fixes
description: Create comprehensive unit tests for the updated regex patterns in BeadsIntegration. Test with various beads output formats: 1) New format: '✓ Created issue: project-name-123', 2) Legacy format: 'Created bd-a1b2c3', 3) Hierarchical IDs: 'responsible-vibe-1.2.3', 4) Edge cases: malformed output, missing matches. Ensure all three methods (createProjectEpic, createPhaseTasks, createEntranceCriteriaTasks) correctly extract task IDs with periods.

title: Commit
description: epcc workflow commit phase tasks

title: Update beads instructions to use bd close instead of bd ready
description: User instructed to change beads instructions from 'bd ready' to 'bd close'. Update generateBeadsInstructions() method in beads-integration.ts and any related documentation or tests to use the correct command for completing tasks.

title: Review and clean up code for production readiness
description: Systematic code cleanup: 1) Remove any debug output or temporary logging, 2) Review TODO/FIXME comments, 3) Clean up experimental code, 4) Ensure proper error handling throughout the beads integration changes. Focus on BeadsIntegration class and start-development.ts changes.

title: Update beads integration documentation
description: Review and update the beads integration documentation (packages/docs/user/beads-integration.md) to reflect the implemented changes: 1) Sequential phase dependencies, 2) Enhanced task description guidance, 3) Updated command examples using 'bd close' instead of 'bd ready', 4) New createPhaseDependencies feature. Ensure documentation matches final implementation.

title: Final validation and testing
description: Run final validation: 1) Execute full test suite to ensure all changes work correctly, 2) Build project to verify no compilation errors, 3) Review test coverage for new functionality, 4) Validate that phase dependency logic and enhanced instructions work as expected. Ensure code is ready for production deployment.

title: Update start-development to store beads phase mapping
description: Modify start-development handler to create beads state via BeadsStateManager when beads integration is set up. Store epic ID and phase task mapping in dedicated beads state instead of conversation state.

title: Create interface contract test framework
description: Implement reusable interface compliance testing utilities and contract tests for IPlanManager, IInstructionGenerator, and other interfaces. Ensure all implementations satisfy interface contracts.

title: Restructure existing tests for strategy pattern
description: Split mixed behavior tests into backend-specific implementation tests while preserving test content. Create enhanced test helpers for backend variant testing without changing existing test logic.

title: Implement beads task completion validation in proceed_to_phase
description: Add validateBeadsTaskCompletion method to ProceedToPhaseHandler. Implement beads mode detection, phase task ID lookup from BeadsStateManager, task completion checking via bd CLI, and comprehensive error handling with user guidance.

title: Add fallback mechanism for existing conversations
description: Implement graceful fallback to plan file parsing for conversations without beads state. The current implementation already handles missing beads state gracefully by returning early when no phase task ID is found.

title: Update server initialization with factory pattern
description: Modify ResponsibleVibeMCPServer initialization to use ServerComponentsFactory. Ensure proper dependency injection and component substitution based on task backend configuration.

title: Migrate and clean up scattered beads logic
description: Remove conditional beads logic from existing components (PlanManager, InstructionGenerator, tool handlers). Ensure all beads-specific functionality is moved to dedicated strategy implementations.

Fix backend detection in instruction-generator-backends.test.ts to use factory pattern instead of direct injection

responsible-vibe: bugfix (development-plan-fix-workflow-state-click.md)
description: Responsible vibe engineering session using bugfix workflow for responsible-vibe

title: Reproduce
description: You are in the bug reproduction phase. Work to reliably reproduce the reported bug by gathering specific information:   • What are the exact OS, browser/runtime versions, and hardware specs?   • What is the precise sequence of actions that trigger the bug?   • What error messages, logs, or stack traces are available?   • Does this happen every time or intermittently?   • How many users are affected and what is the business impact?  Create test cases that demonstrate the problem. Document your findings and create tasks as needed.

title: Gather environment and system details
description: Collect OS, browser versions, and system specs to understand the environment where the workflow visualizer bug occurs

title: Identify workflow visualizer location and examine current behavior
description: Find the workflow visualizer component and examine its current clickability behavior

title: Reproduce the clickability issue step-by-step
description: Document exact steps to reproduce the non-clickable workflow states issue

title: Analyze
description: You are in the bug analysis phase. Examine the code paths involved in the bug, identify the root cause, and understand why the issue occurs. Use debugging tools, add logging, and trace through the problematic code. Document your analysis and create tasks as needed.

title: Analyze Vue component event binding in WorkflowVisualizer.vue
description: Examine how the Vue component in WorkflowVisualizer.vue handles SVG element creation and event binding

title: Trace PlantUMLRenderer makeSVGInteractive function
description: Examine the makeSVGInteractive method in PlantUMLRenderer.ts to understand why event handlers are not being attached to SVG elements

title: Investigate SVG element identification and selector logic
description: Analyze how SVG elements are identified and selected for event binding, check if state/link selectors match actual PlantUML output

title: Fix
description: Implement the solution based on your analysis. If  exists, follow the design from . Before implementing, assess the approach:   • How critical is this system? What is the blast radius if the fix causes issues?   • Should this be a minimal fix or a more comprehensive solution? Make targeted changes that address the root cause without introducing new issues. Be careful to maintain existing functionality while fixing the bug.

title: Fix state element selector in makeSVGInteractive
description: Update the state element selector to match actual PlantUML SVG structure where states have empty IDs but contain text elements with state names

title: Fix transition element selector for lnkN pattern
description: Update transition element selector to match actual PlantUML link IDs (lnk3, lnk4, etc.) instead of expecting link_ prefix

title: Test the fix with workflow visualizer
description: Test that click handlers work correctly after updating selectors in the workflow visualizer

title: Investigate why PlantUML SVG lost meaningful IDs
description: Research why PlantUML no longer generates state IDs and transition link_ patterns. This could be a regression from PlantUML service changes or code changes.

title: Verify
description: You are in the bug verification phase. Test the fix thoroughly to ensure the original bug is resolved and no new issues were introduced. Run existing tests, create new ones if needed, and verify the solution is robust.

title: Finalize
description: You are in the finalize phase. This phase ensures code quality and documentation accuracy through systematic cleanup and review. **STEP 1: Code Cleanup** Systematically clean up development artifacts: 1. **Remove Debug Output**: Search for and remove all temporary debug output statements used during bug investigation.    Look for language-specific debug output methods (console logging, print statements, debug output functions).    Remove any debugging statements that were added for investigation purposes.  2. **Review TODO/FIXME Comments**:    - Address each TODO/FIXME comment by either implementing the solution or documenting why it's deferred    - Remove completed TODOs    - Convert remaining TODOs to proper issue tracking if needed  3. **Remove Debugging Code Blocks**:    - Remove temporary debugging code, test code blocks, and commented-out code    - Clean up any experimental code that's no longer needed    - Ensure proper error handling replaces temporary debug logging  **STEP 2: Documentation Review** Review and update documentation to reflect the bug fix:   1. **Update Long-Term Memory Documents**: Based on what was actually implemented:     • If  exists, update  if design details were refined or changed during the fix 2. **Compare Against Implementation**: Review documentation against the actual bug fix implemented 3. **Update Changed Sections**: Only modify documentation sections that have functional changes 4. **Remove Development Progress**: Remove references to investigation iterations, progress notes, and temporary decisions 5. **Focus on Final State**: Ensure documentation describes the final fixed state, not the debugging process 6. **Ask User to Review Document Updates**: Ask the document changes **STEP 3: Final Validation** - Run existing tests to ensure cleanup didn't break functionality - Verify documentation accuracy with a final review - Ensure bug fix is ready for production   Update task progress and mark completed work as you finalize the bug fix.

title: Remove debug output and console.log statements
description: Clean up any console.log statements added during bug investigation and transition debugging

title: Update plan file entrance criteria
description: Update finalize phase entrance criteria to reflect completion status

title: Final validation build and test
description: Run final build and verify everything works correctly after cleanup

title: responsible-vibe: tdd (development-plan-refactor-extension-system.md)
description: Responsible vibe engineering session using tdd workflow for responsible-vibe

title: Explore
description: You are in the TDD exploration phase. Your main objective now is to gather context about what needs to be developed. Focus on the WHY and WHAT, not the HOW. Research the codebase, understand existing patterns, If you are not certain about conventions or rules, ask the user about them.  Read relevant files and documentation. If  exists, understand and document requirements there, otherwise document them in your task management system.  Don't write code or tests yet - focus on understanding. Document your findings and create tasks as needed.

title: Red
description: You are in the RED phase of TDD. Write a failing test that defines the expected behavior.  **CRITICAL QUALITY GATE**: Before writing the test, ask the user about: 1. What type of test is appropriate (unit, integration, acceptance, etc.) 2. Validate with the user that your test actually tests what needs to be developed  Write a test that: - Clearly defines the expected behavior - Will fail initially (since the functionality doesn't exist yet) - Is specific and focused on one aspect of the functionality - Uses appropriate assertions (not assert(true) or similar meaningless checks)   Run the test to confirm it fails for the right reason. Document the test and update task progress as needed.

title: Green
description: You are in the GREEN phase of TDD. Write only the necessary code to make the failing test pass with a proper implementation.  **CRITICAL QUALITY GATE**: Verify your implementation has NO dirty hacks such as: - assert(true) or similar meaningless assertions - Hardcoded return values that don't represent real logic - Shortcuts that bypass the actual functionality - Copy-paste code without understanding  Focus on: - Making the test pass with real, working code - Writing only what's necessary (no over-engineering) - Ensuring the solution actually solves the problem - Implementing proper logic, not shortcuts - Running the test to confirm it passes   Document your implementation approach and update task progress as needed.

title: Refactor
description: You are in the REFACTOR phase of TDD. This is the cleanup phase - improve code quality while keeping all tests green.  Focus on: - Removing code duplication - Improving variable and function names - Extracting methods for better organization - Simplifying complex logic - Enhancing readability and maintainability - Applying appropriate design patterns  **Safety Rules**: - Run tests after each refactoring change - If any test breaks, immediately revert the change - Make small, incremental improvements - Stop when code is clean and no obvious improvements remain   Document significant refactoring decisions and update task progress as needed.
